messages.content: No more gridlock. No more delays. It's time to get stuff done. Let's be honest. The country has been stuck in a rut. Parliament spent the last three years going round in circles - agreeing on nothing except more arguments. Don't you think it's time to get on with the country's priorities? Don't you think it's time to stop arguing about the past and start building the kind of future we want? A future where you don't have to wait three weeks for a GP appointment - because our NHS has the extra funding it needs to thrive. A future where your streets are safe no matter where you live - because our Police have the officers they need to get a grip on crime. A future where your children have a world-class education - because no school is underfunded or left behind. This is the kind of future we can create together. It's just within our grasp. So let's put the last three years behind us. Let's get a parliament that works for you. We'll get Brexit done with our deal that's ready to go from day one of a new parliament. It protects jobs and trade - with no more dither or delay. Then we can get on with the country’s priorities that we all share. Better hospitals. Safer streets. World-class schools. And a growing economy. We can unleash Britain's potential. But it starts with you. At this election, vote to get on with the country's priorities. Vote Conservative.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cutting income tax for 32 million people.
An extra £14 billion for schools across the country.
30 hours a week of free childcare.
Growing the economy for nine years in a row.

Working parents deserve all the help we can give them. That's why we've doubled the amount of tax-free childcare that families can get. Working parents on Universal Credit get 30 hours a week of free childcare. Helping parents save around £5,000 a year per child.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Seats like Southampton Itchen will decide this election. This seat is because the Conservatives need to hold seats like this to secure a majority government. Last time, there were just a handful of votes in it. To secure a majority government, vote for Royston Smith here.

issues.brexitEurope: We'll get Brexit done with our deal that's ready to go from day one of a new parliament.
issues.economy: Growing our economy for nine years in a row.
issues.education: An extra £14 billion over the next three years into schools. An extra £780 million for children with special educational needs.
issues.health: A future where you don't have to wait three weeks for a GP appointment - because our NHS has the extra funding it needs to thrive. Better hospitals.
issues.labourEmployment: Helping the lowest-paid people out of poverty. Helping working parents save around £5,000 a year per child. Double the amount of tax-free childcare families can get.
issues.lawCrime: A future where your streets are safe no matter where you live - because our Police have the officers they need to get a grip on crime. Safer streets.

examples: In 2010, Labour left public finances in chaos.
Do you really want to risk Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister?
The Lib Dems can't win a majority. So a vote for the Lib Dems means we'll get another hung parliament.
